what: Utility Functions for Data Processing of Iquizoo Games

title: Utility Functions for Data Processing of Iquizoo Games

title: Utility Functions for Data Processing of Iquizoo Games
text: deal various formats datasets, function accepts two special input arguments: .input: input variable names used data.frame typed data. .extra: special values certain variable. example, value used indicate "congruent" type stimuli.

title: Behavioral Pattern Separation (BPS) task — bps
text: tibble contains following values: pc Percent correct responses. p_sim_foil Percent similar responses "foil" stimuli. p_sim_lure Percent similar responses "lure" stimuli. p_sim_target Percent similar responses "target" stimuli. bps_score BPS score.

title: Congruence effect — calc_cong_eff
text: Utility function calculate congruence effect sizes.

title: Congruence effect — calc_cong_eff
text: data Raw data class data.frame. .column name(s) data used grouped . set NULL (default), data treated one subject grouping columns value returned. name_cong column name data input whose values congruence information, character vector "incongruent condition" (label: "inc") "congruent condition" (label: "con"). coerced factor vector two levels. name_acc column name data input whose values user's correctness, numeric vector coded 1 means scoring correct, 0 means scoring incorrect, -1 means response made. name_rt column name data input whose values user's reaction time, numeric vector NA values representing abnormal reaction times.

title: Congruence effect — calc_cong_eff
text: tibble contains congruence effect results accuracy response time.

title: Signal Detection Theory — calc_sdt
text: Calculate sensitivity index bias based signal detection theory. correction extreme proportions zero one "log-linear" rule recommended .Hautus (1995).

title: Signal Detection Theory — calc_sdt
text: data Raw data class data.frame. .column name(s) data used grouped . set NULL (default), data treated one subject grouping columns value returned. name_acc column name data input whose values user's correctness, numeric vector coded 1 means scoring correct, 0 means scoring incorrect, -1 means response made. name_type column name data input whose values stimuli types, character vector value "s" (denoting "signal") "n" (denoting "non-signal") . coerced factor vector two levels. keep_counts logical value. Whether counts correct error returned. Default TRUE.

title: Signal Detection Theory — calc_sdt
text: tibble contains sensitivity index bias (counts measures)

what: Calculate basic speed and accuracy scores — calc_spd_acc
title: Calculate basic speed and accuracy scores — calc_spd_acc
text: function calculates reaction time accuracy scores, basic tests.

title: Calculate basic speed and accuracy scores — calc_spd_acc
code: calc_spd_acc(   data,   .by,   name_acc,   name_rt,   rm.out = TRUE,   rt_rtn = c("both", "mean", "sd", "none"),   acc_rtn = c("both", "count", "percent", "none") )

title: Calculate basic speed and accuracy scores — calc_spd_acc
text: data Raw data class data.frame. .column name(s) data used grouped . set NULL (default), data treated one subject grouping columns value returned. name_acc column name data input whose values user's correctness, numeric vector coded 1 means scoring correct, 0 means scoring incorrect, -1 means response made. name_rt column name data input whose values user's reaction time, numeric vector NA values representing abnormal reaction times. rm.logical value. Whether remove outlier . Default TRUE. rt_rtn mean standard deviation response times returned. acc_rtn count percent correct responses returned.

title: Calculate basic speed and accuracy scores — calc_spd_acc
text: tibble contains required scores.

title: Calculate basic speed and accuracy scores — calc_spd_acc
text: major part behavior tests speed accuracy metrics, actually ones test collects. Based two metrics, two basic groups scores can obtained. first group contains mean standard deviations response times number, second contains number percent correct responses.

title: Calculate basic speed and accuracy scores — calc_spd_acc
text: Outlier removal recommended set default . outlier detection method used "interquantile range" rule suggested Tukey (1977).

title: Switch cost — calc_switch_cost
text: data Raw data class data.frame. .column name(s) data used grouped . set NULL (default), data treated one subject grouping columns value returned. name_type_block column name data input whose values block type, character vector "pure block" (value: "pure") "mixed block" (value: "mixed"). name_type_switch column name data input whose values switch type, character vector least "switch" "repeat" values. values corresponding "pure" block, used task names. name_rt column name data input whose values user's reaction time, numeric vector NA values representing abnormal reaction times. name_acc column name data input whose values user's correctness, numeric vector coded 1 means scoring correct, 0 means scoring incorrect, -1 means response made.

title: Count Correct Responses — counts
text: functions count number correct responses. countcorrect() counts correct responses regardless errors, countcorrect2() subtracts number errors number correct responses, sumweighted() counts correct responses giving weight different responses, sumscore() adds score response.

title: Count Correct Responses — counts
code: countcorrect(data, .by = NULL, .input = NULL, .extra = NULL)  countcorrect2(data, .by = NULL, .input = NULL, .extra = NULL)  sumweighted(data, .by = NULL, .input = NULL, .extra = NULL)  sumscore(data, .by = NULL, .input = NULL, .extra = NULL)

title: Count Correct Responses — counts
text: data Raw data class data.frame. .column name(s) data used grouped . set NULL (default), data treated one subject grouping columns value returned. .input, .extra list() containing input variable names special values certain variables. See details section.

title: Count Correct Responses — counts
text: tibble contains following values: nc Count correct responses. countcorrect(). nc_cor Corrected count correct responses (subtracting number errors). countcorrect2(). nc_weighted Count weighted correct responses. sumweighted(). nc_score Sum scores. sumscore().

what: Task Switching and Stroop-like paradigm — switch-congruence
title: Task Switching and Stroop-like paradigm — switch-congruence
text: task switching paradigms, two types tasks switch , "switch cost" can calculated (using switchcost()). Similarly, Stroop-like tasks, stimuli classified two conditions (.e., "congruent" "incongruent"), "congruence effect" can calculated (using congeff()). also special types tests congruence effect switch cost exist, complexswitch() calculates .

title: Task Switching and Stroop-like paradigm — switch-congruence
code: complexswitch(data, .by = NULL, .input = NULL, .extra = NULL)  congeff(data, .by = NULL, .input = NULL, .extra = NULL)  switchcost(data, .by = NULL, .input = NULL, .extra = NULL)

title: Task Switching and Stroop-like paradigm — switch-congruence

title: Task Switching and Stroop-like paradigm — switch-congruence
text: tibble following variables: congruence effect: mrt_con Mean reaction time congruent trials. mrt_inc Mean reaction time incogruent trials. cong_eff_rt Congruence effect reaction time (RT), .e., incongruent RT - congruent RT. pc_con Percent correct congruent trials. pc_inc Percent correct incogruent trials. cong_eff_pc Congruency effect percent correct (PC), .e., congruent PC - incongruent PC. switch cost: mrt_pure Mean reaction time non-mixed blocks. mrt_repeat Mean reaction time repeat trials. mrt_switch Mean reaction time switch trials. switch_cost_rt_gen General switch cost (based mean reaction times). switch_cost_rt_spe Specific switch cost (based mean reaction times). pc_pure Percent correct non-mixed blocks. pc_repeat Percent correct repeat trials. pc_switch Percent correct switch trials. switch_cost_pc_gen General switch cost (based percent correct). switch_cost_pc_spe Specific switch cost (based percent correct).

title: preproc.iquizoo 2.2.1
text: Added new function reinf() support reinforcement learning tests. Support threshold calculation staircase() inflection point.

title: preproc.iquizoo 2.2.1
text: Fixed issues synwin() caused new design test. Now response times corrected -response trials stop signal test.

title: preproc.iquizoo 2.2.0
text: Added new function dualnback() support dual n-back tests. Added new function staircase() support tests shipped staircase method. Added new function synwin() support modified SynWin test. Now span() can deal location memory test. Supported new design london tower test.

title: preproc.iquizoo 2.2.0
text: Added partical credit score simple complex span tests (#36). Changed algorithm get stop signal reaction time Stop Signal Paradigm based recent eLife publication (#56). Added support ncorrect nerror input countcorrect() countcorrect2(). Enhanced reaction time outlier detection (#61). Enhanced fitting weber fraction numerosity task trial-based maximum likelihood estimation.

title: preproc.iquizoo 2.1.0
text: Now options() support removed, accept two additional arguments .input .extra.

title: preproc.iquizoo 2.0.1
text: Remove global variables.

title: preproc.iquizoo 2.0.0
text: Removed support custom-defined json configuration file. Added support configure function behavior options(), now including input variable names data specific values certain variables. Now preproc() removed believed place refactoring.

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.3.3
text: Remove several unused package dependency.

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.3.2
text: Changed argument names prep_fun .fn .respectively. See reasons. vars_input also renamed .input.

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.3.1
text: Remove “Datasets” section pkgdown site.

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.3.0
text: Now internal data moved {data.iquizoo} package. Now preproc() accepts custom-defined functions custom-defined configurations (input output variable names) custom .json file.

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.2.1
text: Now package named “preproc.iquizoo”. game_info data moved {data.iquizoo} package.

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.2.0
text: integrating “{dm}” package, moved wrangle_data() back {tarflow.iquizoo}, renamed preproc_data() preproc().

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.1.1
text: Added games game_info data.

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.1.0
text: Added new function wrange_data() (originally {tarflow.iquizoo}). Now removes duplicates data. Added two indices refframe() distance error aggregating conditions.

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.0.5
text: Support edge case span() number correct responses can recovered columns "stim" "resp". Use care, take order consideration!

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.0.4
text: Support input cancellation games data cpt().

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.0.4
text: Now cancellation games use cpt() preprocessing function.

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.0.3
text: Changed behavior preproc_data() make sure restores attributes input data.

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.0.3
text: Now pipe rlang helpers re-exported package.

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.0.2
text: Add subtle new feature now keywords supported nback(). Specifically, can now use "filler" "target" keywords. Add another subtle new feature can ignore case character vectors. example, "filler" "Filler" okay now, "Filler" errorproof previous versions.

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.0.1
text: Added games data game_info, mostly questionnaires (#27, thanks @Blockhead-yj). Fixed case issues data name. Now lowercase used thoroughly data names (note snake_case, readability consideration).

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.0.0
text: Add support group-wise calculation, implemented using new “entry-point” function preproc_data() input argument (#23, #25).

title: preproc.iquizoo 1.0.0
text: Use log-linear correction extreme proportions calculation d’ based signal detection theory (#16).

title: preproc.iquizoo 0.2.8
text: Add games game_info data.

title: preproc.iquizoo 0.2.7
text: Completely removed conflict(), defunct many versions. Used 3rd version test framework testthat package, especially takes advantage snapshot test (goden test) simplify tests. Unified abnormal output setting NAs NA_real. Unified response metrics checking. Now many games need minimal valid response rate 80% minimal accuracy rate, . Use ?tarflow.iquizoo:::check_resp_metric see details. Note function exported now.

title: preproc.iquizoo 0.2.6
text: Add external data game_info, stores games information preprocessing functions. Run ?game_info R read details.

title: preproc.iquizoo 0.2.5
text: Fixed bug occured function london() user respond data still scored user correct. Added response rate check london(). Now score normal response rate less 80%.

title: preproc.iquizoo 0.2.4
text: Just complexswitch(), now switchcost() also return abnormal result (NAs) least one block responses.

title: preproc.iquizoo 0.2.3
text: Fix bug occured function multisense() users respond sound trials.

title: preproc.iquizoo 0.2.2
text: Fix bug occured function wxpred() filling NA values name_block (mostly just Block) column. Fix bug occured function driving() minus signs, confused hyphens, logged data.

title: preproc.iquizoo 0.2.1
text: Now complexswitch() return abnormal result (NAs) least one block responses.

title: preproc.iquizoo 0.2.0
text: Rename package “preprocr2” “preproc.iquizoo”. recommended work related www.iquizoo.com.

title: preproc.iquizoo 0.1.4
text: Added utility function calc_sdt() calculate signal detection theory related indices. Fixed issue related perfect accuracy drm().

title: preproc.iquizoo 0.1.3
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added pc_all index, meaning overal percent correct, wxpred function.
